turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Raise the sails.

turns.speaker: GILLETTE
turns.text: The wind is quarter from astern ... by the time we're underway, we'll never catch them.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: We need only to come about, to put them in range of the long nines.

turns.speaker: GILLETTE
turns.text: Hands!  Come about!  Jackets off the cannons!  We are to fire on our own ship?

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Better to see it at the bottom of the sea than in the hands of a pirate.

turns.speaker: GILLETTE
turns.text: All the men in place, sir.  Ready to fire.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Wait for my order -- what the blazes is that?

turns.speaker: GILLETTE
turns.text: Sir!  Shall I break out the cannons?

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: I don't think that will be necessary.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Dead serious.

turns.speaker: GILLETTE
turns.text: You understand this ship cannot be crewed by only two men.  You'll never make it out of the bay.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We'll see about that.

turns.speaker: GILLETTE
turns.text: Sir, I'll not see any of my men killed or wounded in this foolish enterprise.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fine by me.  We brought you a nice little boat, so you can all get back to shore, safe and sound.

turns.speaker: GILLETTE
turns.text: Agreed.  You have the momentary advantage, sir.  But I will see you smile from the yard arm, sir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: As likely as not.  Will, short up the anchor, we've got ourselves a ship!

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: This dock is off-limits to civilians.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sorry, I didn't know.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Some sort of to-do up at the fort, eh?  You two weren't invited?

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: No ... somone has to make sure this dock stays off-limits to civilians.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This must be some important boat.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's a fine goal, I'm sure ... But it seems to me a ship like that --  -- makes this one here just a wee superflous.

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: Oh, the Dauntless is the power in these waters, true enough -- but there's no ship that can match the Interceptor for speed.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That so?  I've heard of one, supposed to be fast, neigh uncatchable ... the Black Pearl?

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Smith.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: None?  Very well.  You rumbled me. I confess: I intend to commandeer one of these ships, pick up a crew in Tortuga, and go on the account, do a little honest pirating.

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: I said, no lies.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Well, well... Jack Sparrow, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Captain Jack Sparrow.  If you please.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Taking stock: you've got a pistol with only one shot, a compass that doesn't point north ... and no ship.  You are without a doubt the worst pirate I have ever heard of.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ah, but you have heard of me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But it seems to be enough to condemn him.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Indeed.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We had time to get to know each other.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: We are bound for Port Royal, not Isla de Muerta.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Norrington, think about it ... the Black Pearl, its captain and crew ... the last pirate threat in the Caribbean.  How can you pass that up?

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: By remembering that I serve others, not only myself.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: I don't like the situation, Mister Sparrow.  The island is riddled with caves.  I will not put my men at a disadvantage.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Funny, I was thinking along those lines.  How about you let me go in alone, and while you're setting up an ambush, I'll trick the pirates out to you.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: You would do that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They left me stranded.  Twice. What have you got to lose?

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Nothing I wouldn't be please to be rid of.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I knew you'd listen to reason!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That chart I drew up'll get you past the reefs.  If you're steersman's good enough, that is.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: I'll be at the wheel myself.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll slip in, talk them into to come out, and you'll be free to blow holy high heaven the whole lot of them.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You look familiar ... Have I ever threatened you before?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I've made a point of avoiding familiarity with pirates.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ah.  Then it would be a shame to put a black mark on your record.  So if you'll excuse me ...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you think this is wise, boy? Crossing blades with a pirate?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You threatened Miss Swann.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Only a little.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who makes all these?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I do.  And I practice with them. At least three hours a day.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You need to find yourself a girl.  Or maybe the reason you practice three hours a day is you've found one -- but can't get her?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You cheated.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pirate.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Move away.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Move!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No.  I can not just step aside and let you escape.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Are you familiar with that ship? The Black Pearl?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Somewhat.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Where does it make berth?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Surely you've heard the stories? The Black Pearl sails from the dreaded Isla de Mureta ... an island that cannot be found -- except by those who already know where it is.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The ship's real enough.  So its anchorage must be a real place. Where is it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why ask me?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Because you're a pirate.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And you want to turn pirate yourself?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Never.  They took Miss Swann.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So it is that you found a girl. Well, if you're intending to brave all and hasten to her rescue and so win fair lady's heart, you'll have to do it alone.  I see no profit in it for me.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I can get you out of here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How?  The key's run off.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I helped build these cells.  Those are hook-and-ring hinges.  The proper application of strength, the door'll lift free.  Just calls for the right lever and fulcrum ...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Agreed.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Agreed!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not without my effects.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We need to go!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Why are brothering with that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: My business, Will.  As for your business -- one question, or there's no use going.  This girl -- what does she mean to you?  How far are you willing to go to save her?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'd die for her.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Come aboard.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I haven't set foot off dry land since I was twelve, when the ship I was on exploded.  It's been a sound policy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No worries there.  She's far more likely to rot out from under us.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We're going to steal a ship?  That ship?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Commandeer.  We're going to commandeer a ship.  Nautical term.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It's still against the law.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So's breaking a man out of jail. Face it, Will: you may say you'll never be a pirate, but you're off to a rip-roaring start.  My advice -- smile and enjoy it.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: This is either crazy, or brilliant.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Remarkable how often those two traits coincide.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Everybody stay calm.  We're taking over the ship!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Aye!  Avast!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: For a man whose made an industry of avoiding boats, you're a quick study.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I worked passage from England as a cabin boy.  After my mother passed, I came out here ... looking for my father.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is that so?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: My father.  William Turner?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I knew him.  Probably one of the few he knew him as William Turner. Most everyone just called him Bill, or 'Bootstrap' Bill.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: 'Bootstrap?'

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good man.  Good pirate.  And clever -- I never met anyone with as clever a mind and hands as him. When you were puzzling out that cell door, it was like seeing his twin.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: That's not true.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I swear, you look just like him.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It's not true my father was a pirate.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Figured you wouldn't want to hear it.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: He was a merchant marine!  He was a respectable man who obeyed the law, and followed the rules--

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You think your father is the only man who ever lived the Glasgow life, telling folk one thing, and then going off to do another? There's quite a few who come here, hoping to amass enough swag to ease the burdens of respectable life. And they're all 'merchant marines.'

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: My father did not think of my mother -- his family -- as a burden.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sure -- because he could always go pirating.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: My father -- was not -- a pirate!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Put it away, Will.  It's not worth getting beat again.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You didn't beat me.  You ignored the rule of engagement.  In a fair fight, I'd kill you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then that's not much incentive for me to fight fair, is it?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Tortuga?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh -- did I forget to mention that?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Just do it quickly.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't worry.  I've already got a Quartermaster -- there!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Shut up, before you lose them all!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: These are the only ones worth having.  And we're going to need them --

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Wait -- what about the pistol?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The pistol.  When a pirate is marooned, Will, he's given a pistol with a single shot.  No good for hunting, or surviving, really.  But after three weeks of starvation and thrist -- the option of that pistol begins to look good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But I survived.  And I still have that single shot.  It's meant for one man.  My mutinous first mate--

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Barbossa.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Depends.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: On what?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: On whether the stories are all true.  If they are, that's a waterfall that spills over at high tide, with a short drop to an underground lagoon.  If not --

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Miss Swann!  We're here to rescue you!  It's going badly!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This way!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll lead them away.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Go to the opposite end of the island, and signal the ship.  I'll keep 'em busy.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Are you sure?  Jack -- this is not something you have to do.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sure.  When you've led the kind of life that I have, there are debts that must be paid.  Maybe I can balance the scales a little.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Will -- don't do anything stupid! Don't say anything stupid --

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: My name is Will Turner, the son of Bootstrap Bill Turner.  His blood runs in my veins.  You need my blood.  And on my word I will pull this trigger, and sink all the way down to Davy Jones' Locker!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you have any idea where you're going?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Jack!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't talk.  These caves magnify sound.  Just follow me.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Are you certain this is the right way?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's the right way.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Jack!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: -- and its guns and crew will cut you and your men to pieces the moment you step outside these caves.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Well, you're the worst pirate I've ever heard of.  You're a man who can be trusted, who can be counted on, and who can't betray his friends.  What kind of pirate is that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The worst.  On the other hand, maybe I'm a man who can't pass up a chance for revenge against the black-hearted bastard who stole my ship and left me to die in the middle of the ocean -- twice! -- and who knows how to get what he wants.  Now that's a great pirate.

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: There's no *real* ship as can match the Interceptor.

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: The Black Pearl is a real ship.

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: No, it's not.

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: Yes it is.  I've seen it.

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: You've seen it?

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: You've seen the Black Pearl?

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: You haven't seen it.

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: Yes, I have.

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: You've seen a ship with black sails that's crewed by the damned and captained by a man so evil that hell itself spat him back out?

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: But I've seen a ship with black sails.

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: Oh, and no ship that's not crewed by the damned and captained by a man so evil that hell itself spat him back out could possibly have black sails and therefore couldn't possibly be any ship other than the Black Pearl.  Is that what you're saying?

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: Like I said, there's no real ship as can match -- Hey!

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: What's your business in Port Royal, 'Mr. Smith'?

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: And no lies!

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: I think he's telling the truth.

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: He's not telling the truth.

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: He may be.

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: If he were telling truth he wouldn't have told us.

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: That Jack Sparrow ... he talked about the Black Pearl.

turns.speaker: MULLROY
turns.text: Mentioned it, is more what he did.

turns.speaker: MURTOGG
turns.text: Still --

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Captain Norrington... I appreciate your fervor, but I am concerned about the effect this subject will have on my daughter.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: My apologies, Governor.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: He's still breathing.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Where did he come from?

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: What happened here?

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: An explosion in the powder magazine. Merchant vessels run heavily armed.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Has my daughter given you an answer yet?

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: No.  She hasn't.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Well, she had a very taxing day... Ghastly weather tonight.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Bleak.  Very bleak.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Commodore --

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: A moment.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: But --

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Dammit, man, it appears someone is stealing your ship!

turns.speaker: SIM
turns.text: How long do you leave him in there?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Until he's done.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Mr. Sim, when you do locate him.  Do not scare him off again.  Just watch him.  I think you can handle that. Right, Mr. Sim?

turns.speaker: SIM
turns.text: You got it, Dr. Argon.

turns.speaker: SIM
turns.text: Look, I don't mean to rain on everyone's ascension here, but we got a little problem.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Speak.

turns.speaker: SIM
turns.text: Dr. Bright has escaped.

turns.speaker: SIM
turns.text: Dr. Argon, everything's starting to come apart here.  You hired me to take care of these matters of security and I am trying, but elements are making my job impossible.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Have you found Dr. Bright?

turns.speaker: SIM
turns.text: No.  The captain of the containment crew is closing down the main lab. He says the area has got to be evacuated.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Wheelchair accessible.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Dr. Argon, I demand an explanation.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Not anymore, Mr. O'Brien.  The nanobot has changed that.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: If you think I would ever give you the nanobot after this, you are deluding yourself.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: You don't have to give it to us because Dr. Nebbleman can just cut it out of him.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Mr. Sim I want you to return to Dr. Bright's.  I believe she is hiding something of ours there.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Dr. Bright, I don't have to do anything.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: But in another twenty-four hours the core meltdown will be beyond the stabilization period.  There will be no way to stop it.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: To be brutally honest with you, Susan, as long as the nanobot does to me what it did to that idiot O'Brien, I don't give a rat's ass about what happens after that.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You can't mean that.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Come with me, Susan.  I want to show you something.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Something to drink, Dr. Bright?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No, thank you.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: You'll forgive me but all the excitement has left me extremely parched.  Poppy?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: We will always love most that which we create.  Don't you agree, Susan?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Does that mean Oppenheimer loved the atomic bomb?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: I brought you up here, Dr. Bright, because I want you to understand that we are on the path.  The only difference is that you are walking with your head down, afraid to look up, to see where the path is going.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I suppose you are going to tell me where it is going.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: I ask you what is the purpose of science?  What is the point of all our relentless exploration, investigation and experimentation? It is to understand a single physical phenomenon, or to understand them all?  To cure one disease, or to cure every disease? If science is simply a means, what then is the end?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Pollution?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Do you know what I see?  I see man making his own clouds.  I see man coloring his own sky, and like this garden it is a site that makes my heart sing.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: This is our world, Susan, and once you realize that, you will understand that the only place our path can end is on the throne of heaven.  Science is the quest for divine perfection.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: How do you know we're not heading in the wrong direction?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: I look behind us, I look to the past, to a world steeped in rot and decay.  I think of the Acropolis in another century reduced to little more than dust.  I see the faces of Rushmore eventually losing all distinction, and then I look at this...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I swear to you, Argon, if you don't stop the meltdown that nanobot will be the last one I ever build.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Susan, I sense you are having difficulty understanding the situation you are presently in.  I ask that you keep in mind that I am ready to reduce an entire city to gelatin to get what I want.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: What are you going to do to him?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Do?  Well, I suppose that depends on you.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: What did you use?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: A light mixture of oxygen, dioxide, and sodium pentothal.  He'll sleep, that's all.

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: I can explain it.  Attempted murder wasn't enough for him.  He wants to add kidnapping to the charges.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: If you'd like, we can go straight to the authorities.  I understand they are very interested in talking to you.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: ... plastic.

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: Wow, that is one moving story.  Take it easy on my heart strings.  Now I really feel guilty complaining about you shooting me up with your poison.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Poison?  I'm surprised at you.  You lack vision, Mr. O'Brien.

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: You're lacking a few things too: ethics, morals, common decency and, oh yeah, deodorant.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: The body is just another part of nature and ever since we gave up trees for central air, there has been nothing sacred about nature. Nature is the enemy, Mr. O'Brien, and science is our greatest weapon against her.

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: You egomaniacs make me laugh. Nature's going to bury you like she buries everyone else.

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: I should kill you right now for what you did to me!

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Maybe you should, but you can't.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: How apropos.

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: Ain't it.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: As you can see I am a new man, just like you.

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: Oh no.  You're not like me.  In fact, I'm betting you're the same greedy, remorseless, egomaniacal bad guy you always were.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: It remains to be seen who is the good guy and who is the bad guy. History is written by the victor.

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: The only history I'm gonna write is your obituary!

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: I know what you're doing.

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: You mean besides kicking your ass?!

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: You think you can use me to stop the meltdown.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Please, O'Brien, don't do this to me!  I'll give you anything you want!

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: Yeah, I'm going to finish what you started --

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: You can't do this!  You owe me, O'Brien.  I made you plastic!  I made you!

turns.speaker: O'BRIEN
turns.text: That's right.  And making me was the biggest mistake you ever made!

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Like rotting meat.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: You're not rotting meat.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Oh no?  Smell this.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Icarus, please, if you want me to give you a bath just say so.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: No.  I'm getting used to it.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: She's working as fast as she can, Icarus.  It will be ready soon.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: It's ready now, I know it is.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: She says it's not.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: She's lying.  She lost the first one on purpose.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: She did not.  The mouse ran down the drain.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: She let it escape because she wants me to die.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Don't be a child, Icarus.  She is just another scientist and like all scientists, she doesn't care about anything outside the world of the laboratory.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Icky!  What's happening?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Who cares!  We've got to find him! Hurry!

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: It works, Poppy.  It works, it works!

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Now, Icky, I don't need you winding yourself up.  I need you focused and in control.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: But, Poppy, you don't know what this means --

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: You don't either.  We won't know anything until we find that guy and find out if he's alive or what.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Yes, that's true.  We have to find him, run tests, determine if the polymerization is stable.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: In the meantime, we're going to need someone to deal with that mess in the lab.  I don't think we should call Dr. Bright.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Oh no.  No.  We'll get her assistant.  What's-his-name? Nebbishman?

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Nebbleman.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: A containment crew is going to attract a lot of attention.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: You're right.  Place a call to our friends at the network and to Mr. Joplin at the E.P.A.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Gently, Ott.  Gently.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Dr. Nebbleman, I want to know the moment the nanobot arrives.  The instant, understand?

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Do you think she will give us the designs?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Eventually.  These things are always a matter of leverage.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: And you think O'Brien is that leverage?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: That remains to be seen.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: And you still believe he's going to come here?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Based on what we know of him, that would seem inevitable.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Do you think she loves him?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: She must feel something for him. After all, she and I did create him.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Poppy, are you in one of your moods again?

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: No, Icky, this is real.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: You know how I feel about you.  You know how much I need you.  How much I trust you.  I would do anything for you.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Why are there two ottomans?

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Icarus, please!  This is important!

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Look at me, Icarus!  Look at my body.  I've done everything, changed anything you asked me to.  'We will always love most that which we create.'  Is that still true?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Yes.  Yes, of course it is.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Then you still love me?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Poppy, please, just tell me what you want.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Icarus?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: I promise, my dear, I will give the matter some consideration.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Consideration?

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: If you honestly trust me, then you'll have to trust me.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: Can you feel it, Poppy?  The presence of the moment?  Can you feel the weight of its significance?

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Oh yes, Icky.  I can feel it.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: This is what my entire life has been directed at, this moment, this threshold.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: Okay, arms up, lean forward.

turns.speaker: ARGON
turns.text: It will be an ascension.

turns.speaker: POPPY
turns.text: I'm so excited, Icarus.
